explanation:
BAD_REQUEST_PAGE: need the definition/type (e.g. const char[], char[]) to know whether the symbol is already const-qualified and whether it is mutable — MISRA requires pointers be const-qualified when possible.

MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static: need the function prototype/signature to know the parameter type for the buffer argument (const void * vs void *) and whether the function promises not to modify or take ownership of the buffer.

MHD_create_response_from_buffer_with_free_callback_cls: this is called/transitively by the static variant; its prototype/implementation shows how the buffer is stored/handled (copied, referenced, freed later via a callback) and whether the implementation may modify or free the buffer (which affects whether the pointer must be non-const).

struct MHD_Response: need the structure definition to see whether the response object stores a pointer to the provided buffer as-is (implying the buffer must remain valid and possibly not be const if later modified/freed) or copies it; also to determine whether any fields imply ownership/alteration of the buffer.

MHD_destroy_response: need its prototype/implementation to determine whether destroying a response will free or otherwise modify the buffer supplied to create_response_from_buffer_static — if destroy frees/modifies the buffer, the buffer cannot safely be const-qualified without appropriate API semantics.

MHD_queue_response: need its prototype/implementation to confirm whether queuing the response transfers ownership or modifies the underlying response or buffer (which would affect whether the original buffer pointer must be non-const).
